page.title: 15 COMMUNICATIONS 3
page.content: ...County Council was the authority concerned. Eventually, said Mr. Platt, he got Oxfordshire to write to them. Meanwhile, the 'phone box had been taken away from outside the post office, even though, Mr. Tester claims he informed Telecom they could leave it there until negotiations for its move were completed. Telecom's public call office manager Mr. Jim Dove, who had been on holiday agreed that when he took the case over he found the wrong authorities had been contacted. Now, however, permission had been granted and Telecom were "proceeding with the re-provision of the call box, but somewhat slowly." They were now only waiting for a quote for supplying power to light the box from the Southern Electricity Board,and as there were seldom any arguments...
